question.title: How can I configure Maven to generate a .war with WebSocket and ensure that the @ServerEndpoint is properly registered with Tomcat?
question.body:
I'm developing a Java Web application that uses WebSocket (javax.websocket) and want to deploy it to Apache Tomcat 9+ as a .war file. I use Maven to build the project and have a class annotated with @ServerEndpoint, for example:

@ServerEndpoint("/ws/echo")
public class EchoEndpoint {
    @OnMessage
    public String onMessage(String message) {
        return "Echo: " + message;
    }
}

The .war file is generated correctly, but when I deploy it to Tomcat, the WebSocket endpoint isn't registered.

Any suggestions or tips for successfully deploying my project?

I've already tried: Ensuring the @ServerEndpoint is in a scanned package.

That the .war file correctly includes the compiled class.

That there are no conflicts with the web.xml configuration (I left it empty).
